summary: This is a government submission in opposition to Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application in the case US v. Maxwell (20 CR. 330). It includes a cover letter, memorandum of law, and two exhibits (A and B) from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Government Files Opposition to Maxwell's Bail Motion
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY submits legal documents opposing Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed application for bail.

locations.name: Southern District of New York
locations.context: Jurisdiction where the case US v. Maxwell is being prosecuted.

locations.name: New York, NY 10007
locations.context: Address (1 St. Andrew's Plaza) of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York formally opposed Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application on December 16, 2020.
The government's submission included a cover letter, memorandum of law, and two exhibits (A and B), indicating substantial legal argument and evidence.
Maxwell's defense team at this time included attorneys Bobbi C Sternheim, Jeff Pagliuca, Mark S. Cohen, and Laura Menninger.
The document shows ongoing pretrial litigation in case 20 CR. 330 regarding Maxwell's detention status while awaiting trial.
